intro: Clidemia haughtii, commonly known as Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and often has a reddish or purplish stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in native forests. Clidemia haughtii is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some areas outside its native range.
